alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 7:18PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northeastern Kit Carson County in east central Colorado and southwestern Cheyenne Counties in northwestern Kansas through 815 PM MDT/915 PM CDT/... At 718 PM MDT/818 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles west of Bonny Reservoir, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northeastern Kit Carson County in east central Colorado and southwestern Cheyenne Counties in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Joes, Hale and Kirk. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 444 and 446. Highway 385 between mile markers 192 and 221. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
